Weakness.Name: Use of Web Link to Untrusted Target with window.opener Access
Weakness.Description: The web application produces links to untrusted external sites outside of its sphere of control, but it does not properly prevent the external site from modifying security-critical properties of the window.opener object, such as the location property.

Weakness.Name: Improper Neutralization of CRLF Sequences in HTTP Headers ('HTTP Request/Response Splitting')
Weakness.Description: The product receives data from an HTTP agent/component (e.g., web server, proxy, browser, etc.), but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes CR and LF characters before the data is included in outgoing HTTP headers.

Weakness.Name: Initialization of a Resource with an Insecure Default
Weakness.Description: The product initializes or sets a resource with a default that is intended to be changed by the product's installer, administrator, or maintainer, but the default is not secure.

Weakness.Name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
Weakness.Description: The product performs operations on a memory buffer, but it reads from or writes to a memory location outside the buffer's intended boundary. This may result in read or write operations on unexpected memory locations that could be linked to other variables, data structures, or internal program data.

Weakness.Name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')
Weakness.Description: The product copies an input buffer to an output buffer without verifying that the size of the input buffer is less than the size of the output buffer.

Weakness.Name: Stack-based Buffer Overflow
Weakness.Description: A stack-based buffer overflow condition is a condition where the buffer being overwritten is allocated on the stack (i.e., is a local variable or, rarely, a parameter to a function).

Weakness.Name: Heap-based Buffer Overflow
Weakness.Description: A heap overflow condition is a buffer overflow, where the buffer that can be overwritten is allocated in the heap portion of memory, generally meaning that the buffer was allocated using a routine such as malloc().

Weakness.Name: Write-what-where Condition
Weakness.Description: Any condition where the attacker has the ability to write an arbitrary value to an arbitrary location, often as the result of a buffer overflow.

Weakness.Name: Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
Weakness.Description: The product saves user-provided information into a Comma-Separated Value (CSV) file, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could be interpreted as a command when the file is opened by a spreadsheet product.

Weakness.Name: Out-of-bounds Read
Weakness.Description: The product reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer.

Weakness.Name: Improper Validation of Specified Quantity in Input
Weakness.Description: The product receives input that is expected to specify a quantity (such as size or length), but it does not validate or incorrectly validates that the quantity has the required properties.

Weakness.Name: Incorrect Calculation of Buffer Size
Weakness.Description: The product does not correctly calculate the size to be used when allocating a buffer, which could lead to a buffer overflow.

Weakness.Name: Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity
Weakness.Description: The product uses a regular expression with an inefficient, possibly exponential worst-case computational complexity that consumes excessive CPU cycles.

Weakness.Name: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
Weakness.Description:
The product performs a calculation that can
         produce an integer overflow or wraparound when the logic
         assumes that the resulting value will always be larger than
         the original value. This occurs when an integer value is
         incremented to a value that is too large to store in the
         associated representation. When this occurs, the value may
         become a very small or negative number.

Weakness.Name: Improper Input Validation
Weakness.Description:
The product receives input or data, but it does
        not validate or incorrectly validates that the input has the
        properties that are required to process the data safely and
        correctly.

Weakness.Name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
Weakness.Description: The product exposes sensitive information to an actor that is not explicitly authorized to have access to that information.

Weakness.Name: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
Weakness.Description: The product uses external input to construct a pathname that is intended to identify a file or directory that is located underneath a restricted parent directory, but the product does not properly neutralize special elements within the pathname that can cause the pathname to resolve to a location that is outside of the restricted directory.

Weakness.Name: Use of Hard-coded Password
Weakness.Description: The product contains a hard-coded password, which it uses for its own inbound authentication or for outbound communication to external components.

Weakness.Name: Improper Privilege Management
Weakness.Description: The product does not properly assign, modify, track, or check privileges for an actor, creating an unintended sphere of control for that actor.

Weakness.Name: Improper Access Control
Weakness.Description: The product does not restrict or incorrectly restricts access to a resource from an unauthorized actor.

Weakness.Name: Improper Authorization
Weakness.Description: The product does not perform or incorrectly performs an authorization check when an actor attempts to access a resource or perform an action.

Weakness.Name: Improper Authentication
Weakness.Description: When an actor claims to have a given identity, the product does not prove or insufficiently proves that the claim is correct.

Weakness.Name: Authentication Bypass by Capture-replay
Weakness.Description: A capture-replay flaw exists when the design of the product makes it possible for a malicious user to sniff network traffic and bypass authentication by replaying it to the server in question to the same effect as the original message (or with minor changes).

Weakness.Name: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
Weakness.Description: The product does not perform any authentication for functionality that requires a provable user identity or consumes a significant amount of resources.

Weakness.Name: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
Weakness.Description: The product transmits sensitive or security-critical data in cleartext in a communication channel that can be sniffed by unauthorized actors.

Weakness.Name: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity
Weakness.Description: The product does not sufficiently verify the origin or authenticity of data, in a way that causes it to accept invalid data.

Weakness.Name: Origin Validation Error
Weakness.Description: The product does not properly verify that the source of data or communication is valid.

Weakness.Name: Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature
Weakness.Description: The product does not verify, or incorrectly verifies, the cryptographic signature for data.

Weakness.Name: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
Weakness.Description: The web application does not, or cannot, sufficiently verify whether a request was intentionally provided by the user who sent the request, which could have originated from an unauthorized actor.

Weakness.Name: Concurrent Execution using Shared Resource with Improper Synchronization ('Race Condition')
Weakness.Description: The product contains a concurrent code sequence that requires temporary, exclusive access to a shared resource, but a timing window exists in which the shared resource can be modified by another code sequence operating concurrently.

Weakness.Name: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
Weakness.Description: The product does not properly control the allocation and maintenance of a limited resource.

Weakness.Name: Missing Release of Memory after Effective Lifetime
Weakness.Description: The product does not sufficiently track and release allocated memory after it has been used, making the memory unavailable for reallocation and reuse.

Weakness.Name: Use After Free
Weakness.Description: The product reuses or references memory after it has been freed. At some point afterward, the memory may be allocated again and saved in another pointer, while the original pointer references a location somewhere within the new allocation. Any operations using the original pointer are no longer valid because the memory "belongs" to the code that operates on the new pointer.

Weakness.Name: Direct Request ('Forced Browsing')
Weakness.Description: The web application does not adequately enforce appropriate authorization on all restricted URLs, scripts, or files.

Weakness.Name: Uncontrolled Search Path Element
Weakness.Description: The product uses a fixed or controlled search path to find resources, but one or more locations in that path can be under the control of unintended actors.

Weakness.Name: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type
Weakness.Description: The product allows the upload or transfer of dangerous file types that are automatically processed within its environment.

Weakness.Name: NULL Pointer Dereference
Weakness.Description: The product dereferences a pointer that it expects to be valid but is NULL.

Weakness.Name: Download of Code Without Integrity Check
Weakness.Description: The product downloads source code or an executable from a remote location and executes the code without sufficiently verifying the origin and integrity of the code.

Weakness.Name: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
Weakness.Description: The product deserializes untrusted data without sufficiently ensuring that the resulting data will be valid.

Weakness.Name: Weak Password Requirements
Weakness.Description: The product does not require that users should have strong passwords.

Weakness.Name: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
Weakness.Description: The product transmits or stores authentication credentials, but it uses an insecure method that is susceptible to unauthorized interception and/or retrieval.

Weakness.Name: Files or Directories Accessible to External Parties
Weakness.Description: The product makes files or directories accessible to unauthorized actors, even though they should not be.

Weakness.Name: Improper Link Resolution Before File Access ('Link Following')
Weakness.Description: The product attempts to access a file based on the filename, but it does not properly prevent that filename from identifying a link or shortcut that resolves to an unintended resource.

Weakness.Name: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
Weakness.Description: The web application accepts a user-controlled input that specifies a link to an external site, and uses that link in a redirect.

Weakness.Name: Client-Side Enforcement of Server-Side Security
Weakness.Description: The product is composed of a server that relies on the client to implement a mechanism that is intended to protect the server.

Weakness.Name: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
Weakness.Description: The system's authorization functionality does not prevent one user from gaining access to another user's data or record by modifying the key value identifying the data.

Weakness.Name: Weak Password Recovery Mechanism for Forgotten Password
Weakness.Description: The product contains a mechanism for users to recover or change their passwords without knowing the original password, but the mechanism is weak.

Weakness.Name: Always-Incorrect Control Flow Implementation
Weakness.Description: The code contains a control flow path that does not reflect the algorithm that the path is intended to implement, leading to incorrect behavior any time this path is navigated.

Weakness.Name: Improper Check or Handling of Exceptional Conditions
Weakness.Description: The product does not properly anticipate or handle exceptional conditions that rarely occur during normal operation of the product.

Weakness.Name: Improper Neutralization
Weakness.Description: The product does not ensure or incorrectly ensures that structured messages or data are well-formed and that certain security properties are met before being read from an upstream component or sent to a downstream component.

Weakness.Name: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
Weakness.Description: The product specifies permissions for a security-critical resource in a way that allows that resource to be read or modified by unintended actors.

Weakness.Name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Output Used by a Downstream Component ('Injection')
Weakness.Description: The product constructs all or part of a command, data structure, or record using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify how it is parsed or interpreted when it is sent to a downstream component.

Weakness.Name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')
Weakness.Description: The product constructs all or part of a command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended command when it is sent to a downstream component.

Weakness.Name: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
Weakness.Description: The product allocates a reusable resource or group of resources on behalf of an actor without imposing any intended restrictions on the size or number of resources that can be allocated.

Weakness.Name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
Weakness.Description: The product constructs all or part of an OS command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended OS command when it is sent to a downstream component.

Weakness.Name: Out-of-bounds Write
Weakness.Description: The product writes data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer.

Weakness.Name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
Weakness.Description: The product does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes user-controllable input before it is placed in output that is used as a web page that is served to other users.

Weakness.Name: Incomplete Filtering of Special Elements
Weakness.Description: The product receives data from an upstream component, but does not completely filter special elements before sending it to a downstream component.

Weakness.Name: Use of Hard-coded Credentials
Weakness.Description: The product contains hard-coded credentials, such as a password or cryptographic key.

Weakness.Name: Reliance on Untrusted Inputs in a Security Decision
Weakness.Description: The product uses a protection mechanism that relies on the existence or values of an input, but the input can be modified by an untrusted actor in a way that bypasses the protection mechanism.

Weakness.Name: Missing Authorization
Weakness.Description: The product does not perform an authorization check when an actor attempts to access a resource or perform an action.

Weakness.Name: Incorrect Authorization
Weakness.Description: The product performs an authorization check when an actor attempts to access a resource or perform an action, but it does not correctly perform the check.

Weakness.Name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
Weakness.Description: The product constructs all or part of an SQL command using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the intended SQL command when it is sent to a downstream component. Without sufficient removal or quoting of SQL syntax in user-controllable inputs, the generated SQL query can cause those inputs to be interpreted as SQL instead of ordinary user data.

Weakness.Name: Improper Control of Dynamically-Managed Code Resources
Weakness.Description: The product does not properly restrict reading from or writing to dynamically-managed code resources such as variables, objects, classes, attributes, functions, or executable instructions or statements.

Weakness.Name: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
Weakness.Description: The web server receives a URL or similar request from an upstream component and retrieves the contents of this URL, but it does not sufficiently ensure that the request is being sent to the expected destination.

Weakness.Name: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
Weakness.Description: The product constructs all or part of a code segment using externally-influenced input from an upstream component, but it does not neutralize or incorrectly neutralizes special elements that could modify the syntax or behavior of the intended code segment.
